post.description:
Creates a Rollout record. A rollout represents the process of nodes acquiring
the latest policy revision pushed to a policy group.

Authorization Action:
```
ingest:unifiedEvents:create
```

get.description:
Returns the rollout for the given Chef Server/org, policy group, policy name, and policy revision

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

Gives a list of rollouts

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the request for the rollouts list.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the request for the node segments list.

get.description:
Returns the rollout with the given Id

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

post.description:
CreateRolloutTest is a no-op endpoint that has the same auth requirements as
CreateRollout. It can be used to verify end-to-end config/connectivity for
clients

Authorization Action:
```
ingest:unifiedEvents:create
```

get.description:
Returns a list of the most common errors reported for infra nodes' most recent Chef Infra Client runs.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
The number of results to return.
If set to zero, the default size of 10 will be used. Set to a negative
value for unlimited results.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filters in the request select the nodes from which the errors are
collected. The same filters may be specified for this request as for other
Nodes requests, with the exception of 'status' which is not valid for this
request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Types of node fields to collect value counts for.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the counts returned.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Earliest most recent check-in node information to return.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Latest most recent check-in node information to return.

get.description:
Provides the status of runs for each 24-hour duration. For multiple runs in one 24-hour duration, 
the most recent failed run will be returned. If there are no failed runs the most recent successful 
run will be returned. If no runs are found in the 24-hour duration, the status will be "missing" 
and no run information will be returned.

Example:
request
```
cfgmgmt/node_runs_daily_status_time_series?node_id=507bd518-5c18-4c2d-a445-60fe7dde9961&days_ago=3
```
response
```
{
"durations": [
{
"start": "2020-04-25T19:00:00Z",
"end": "2020-04-26T18:59:59Z",
"status": "missing",
"run_id": ""
},
{
"start": "2020-04-26T19:00:00Z",
"end": "2020-04-27T18:59:59Z",
"status": "missing",
"run_id": ""
},
{
"start": "2020-04-27T19:00:00Z",
"end": "2020-04-28T18:59:59Z",
"status": "failure",
"run_id": "b7904f41-68b5-44ec-9da6-cf2481ff8600"
}
]
}
```

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: Node ID of the runs.

parameters.name: days_ago
parameters.description: Number of past days.

get.description:
Returns a list of infra nodes that have checked in to Automate.
Adding a filter makes a list of all nodes that meet the filter criteria.
Filters for the same field are ORd together, while filters across different fields are ANDed together.
Supports pagination, filtering (with wildcard support), and sorting.
Limited to 10k results.

Example:
```
cfgmgmt/nodes?pagination.page=1&pagination.size=100&sorting.field=name&sorting.order=ASC&filter=name:mySO*&filter=platform:ubun*
```

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the request for nodes list.

parameters.name: pagination.page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return.

parameters.name: pagination.size
parameters.description: Amount of results to include per page.

parameters.name: sorting.field
parameters.description: Field to sort the list results on.

parameters.name: sorting.order
parameters.description: Order the results should be returned in.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Earliest most recent check-in node information to return.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Latest most recent check-in node information to return.

get.description:
Returns the latest reported attributes for the provided node ID.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:get
```

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: Chef guid for the requested node.

get.description:
Returns a list of run metadata (id, start and end time, and status) for the provided node ID.
Supports pagination.
Accepts a `start` parameter to denote start date for the list and a filter of type `status`.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: Chef guid for the node.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to apply to the request for runs list.

parameters.name: pagination.page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return.

parameters.name: pagination.size
parameters.description: Amount of results to include per page.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Earliest (in history) run information to return for the runs list.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Latest (in history) run information to return for the runs list.

get.description:
Returns the infra run report for the provided node ID and run ID.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:get
```

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: Chef guid for the requested node.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: Run id for the node.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time on the node's run.

get.description:
Returns a list of all organizations associated with nodes that have checked in to Automate.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

Returns Policy Names with a list of cookbook names and associated policy identifiers based on a policy revision ID. 
Policy revision IDs are sent with an infra run report and identifies which instance of a policy the node used for this run.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: revision_id
parameters.description: Revision id for the policy.

get.description:
Returns a list of all Chef Infra Servers associated with nodes that have checked in to Automate.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

Returns a daily time series of unique node check-ins for the number of days requested.
If `days ago` value is empty, API will return the default 1 day ago results.

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: List of filters to be applied to the time series.

parameters.name: days_ago
parameters.description: Number of past days to create the time series.

get.description:
Returns a count of missing nodes for the provided durations.

Example:
```
cfgmgmt/stats/missing_node_duration_counts?durations=3d&durations=1w&durations=2w&durations=1M&durations=3M
```

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: durations
parameters.description:
A valid duration is any number zero or greater with one of these characters 'h', 'd', 'w', or 'M'. 
'h' is hours
'd' is days
'w' is weeks
'M' is months
Will contain one or many.

get.description:
Returns totals for failed, success, missing, and overall total infra nodes that have reported into Automate.
Supports filtering.

Example:
```
cfgmgmt/stats/node_counts?filter=name:mySO*&filter=platform:ubun*
```

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: List of filters to be applied to the node count results.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Earliest node check-in.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Latest node check-in.

get.description:
Returns totals for failed and successful runs given a `node_id`.

Example:
```
cfgmgmt/stats/run_counts?node_id=821fff07-abc9-4160-96b1-83d68ae5cfdd&start=2019-11-02
```

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: List of filters to be applied to the run count results.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Earliest (in history) run information to return for the run counts.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Latest (in history) run information to return for the run counts.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: Node id associated with the run.

get.description:
Returns possible filter values given a valid `type` parameter. All values returned until two or more characters are provided for the `text` parameter.
Supports wildcard (* and ?).

Example:
```
cfgmgmt/suggestions?type=environment&text=_d
```

Authorization Action:
```
infra:nodes:list
```

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Field for which suggestions are being returned.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to search on for the type value.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to be applied to the results.

chef.automate.api.cfgmgmt.request.Create.description:
CreateRollout is a request to create a new Rollout. All
fields have the same meaning as with the response Rollout
type.

message.description: Error message for the failed run.

policy_identifier.description: Policy identifier for the cookbook lock.

count.title: The number of nodes for this duration

rollout.description: Rollout is the full rollout object, but we can change this to be a subset only.

node_count.title: Nodes that have run the code being rolled out thus far

latest_run_successful_count.description: I'm assuming it's easy to get the status when we get the counts.

chef.automate.api.cfgmgmt.response.Error.title:
ErrorCount gives the number of occurrences (count) of the error specified by
the type and message among the nodes included by the request parameters

chef.automate.api.cfgmgmt.response.Error.description:
Errors contains a list of the most common Chef Infra error type/message
combinations among nodes in the active project as filtered according to the
request.

id.description: Id of the run list collection.

node_id.description: The chef_guid associated with the node.

normal.description: Stringified json of the normal attributes for the node.

default.description: Stringified json of the default attributes for the node.

override.description: Stringified json of the override attributes for the node.

automatic.description: Stringified json of the automatic attributes for the node.

normal_value_count.description: Count of normal attributes on the node.

default_value_count.description: Count of default attributes on the node.

override_value_count.description: Count of override attributes on the node.

all_value_count.description: Total count of attributes on the node.

automatic_value_count.description: Count of automatic attributes on the node.

types.title: Field Types for a node with value counts

policy_name.title:
policy_name, policy_node_group, policy_domain_url make up a "compound
id" for the node segment

total_nodes.title: total nodes in elasticsearch in the node segment

previous_rollouts.title:
This is the last, say 2 or 4 rollouts before the current one (to give a
total of 3 or 5)

node_segment_rollout_progress.description:
The NodeSegmentRolloutProgress are sorted by policy group, policy
name, then domain URL.

chef.automate.api.cfgmgmt.response.NodeS.description:
A Node Segment is the set of Chef Infra nodes with a shared policy_name,
policy_node_group, and policy_domain_url.

NodeSegmentsWithRolloutProgress lists all of the node segments matching the
request with information about the progress and status of the code rollouts for each segment.
chef.automate.api.cfgmgmt.response.NodeS.title: NodeSegmentsWithRolloutProgress

total.description: Total count of nodes that have reported in to Automate.

success.description: Total count of nodes that have reported in to Automate whose last run was successful.

failure.description: Total count of nodes that have reported in to Automate whose last run was failed.

missing.description: Total count of nodes that have been labeled as 'missing' as determined by node lifecycle settings.

rollout.description: Rollout is the full rollout object, but we can change this to be a subset only.

latest_run_node_count.description:
The number of nodes in the node segment for which the last recorded CCR
was part of this rollout. Note that no breakdown of success/errored is
provided, since some nodes may have moved on to the current rollout and
are not included in the count.

delta.description: Change diff for the resource (if it was changed during the run).

cookbook_name.description: Cookbook name associated with the resource.

cookbook_version.description: Version of the cookbook associated with the resource.

recipe_name.description: Name of the recipe associated with the resource.

conditional.description: Conditional rule associated with the resource.

ignore_failure.description: Boolean that denotes whether or not the resource failure should be ignored.

policy_name.title: The name of the policy, i.e., the `name` attribute in the Policyfile

policy_node_group.description:
The group of nodes which are targeted by the rollout. In the Chef Server
case, this is the policy_group to which the user is pushing the policy.

policy_revision_id.title: The revision_id of the compiled policy being rolled out

policy_domain_url.description:
In the Chef Server case, the policy domain URL is the Chef Server URL
with the `/organizations/:orgname` portion of the URL path included. In
general, this can be a URL for any content storage/distribution service,
as long as the combination of policy_name and policy_node_group is unique
on that system.

The set of nodes configured to fetch policy content from the
policy_domain_url and configured with the same policy_name and
policy_node_group form the target set of nodes for a rollout and are
expected to apply the policy revision described by the rollout.

scm_type.title: The source control system used with the policyfile

scm_web_type.title: The software/service used to host the source code repository

policy_scm_url.title: The URL used to obtain a copy of the source code repository

policy_scm_web_url.title: The URL used to view the source code repository via the web

policy_scm_commit.description:
The source control system's identifier for the repository version. This
should be the version where the policy's lockfile was committed.

description.description:
A free-form description of the rollout, as given by the user. Long
messages may be displayed in a truncated form in the UI. The content may
be entered manually by the user or extracted from another system, for
example a git commit message.

ci_job_url.description:
If the rollout was initiated via Ci/CD or similar system, the web URL
for the job that initiated the rollout.

ci_job_id.description:
If the rollout was initiated by Ci/CD or similar system, the id of the job
that initiated the rollout. Should include the Ci system's nickname or
other identifying information users would need to associate the job ID to
the Ci/CD system.

id.description:
The system-generated ID for this rollout. The system currently provides
autoincrementing integers for the Ids.

start_time.description:
The time that the rollout began. Whenever a new rollout is created, it
becomes the "current" rollout for its node segment; that is, any nodes
that start a Chef Infra Client run will run the policy revision described
by this "current" rollout. The system will populate the previously current
rollout's `end_time` attribute with the current time.

end_time.description: The time that the rollout was replaced with another rollout.

scm_author_name.description:
The username of the author of the most recent commit to the source code
repository. In git, this is the setting `user.name`.

scm_author_email.description:
The email address of the author of the most recent commit to the source
code repository. In git, this is the setting `user.email`.

policy_domain_username.description:
The username of the entity who uploaded/promoted the policy code to the
code host. In a Chef Server architecture, this is the name of the Chef
Server user who ran the `chef push` command to upload the policy.

chef.automate.api.cfgmgmt.response.Rollo.description:
A Rollout represents the process of distributing Chef Infra code (with
Policyfiles) to a set of nodes. It's used to track which nodes have run the
latest version of the Chef Infra code assigned to them and also provide the
user insights about the code by aggregating Chef Client run results
according to the version of Chef Infra code applied. Metadata about the code
is stored in order to provide the user with convenient references back to
systems they already use (such as SCM and Ci/CD systems) to manage their code.

Nodes are segmented by a triple of policy name, policy group, and policy domain URL:
policy name generally describes what kind of system it is, e.g., a database server
policy group generally describes where the system fits in the user's code
lifecycle, e.g., "QA" or "production." Policy groups may also represent a
subset of nodes within a code lifecycle stage, such as a "production-canary"
group.
policy domain URL identifies the system that distributes the Chef Infra code
and is the owner of the namespaces for policy name and group. E.g., a Chef
Server URL with the `/organizations/:orgname` part.

There is one (or zero) revision(s) of the Chef Infra code applied to any
segment at a time. Rollouts track the changes to which revision of the code is
applied to the node segments over time.

id.description: Id of the infra node run.

node_id.description: The chef_guid associated with the node.

organization.description: The organization the node is associated with.

start_time.description: Start time of the infra run.

end_time.description: End time of the infra run.

source.description: Source of the node run (e.g. chef-solo).

status.description: Status of the infra node run.

total_resource_count.description: Resource count reported on the infra node run.

updated_resource_count.description: Count of resources updated in the infra node run.

uptime_seconds.description: Count in seconds that the node has been active.

source_fqdn.description: Chef server associated with the node.

error.description: Chef Error information, available on failed runs.

resource_names.description: List of resource names for the node.

recipes.description: List of recipes the node calls.

chef_tags.description: List of tags associated with the node.

cookbooks.description: List of cookbooks associated with the node.

platform.description: Full platform string for the node (family + version).

roles.description: List of roles associated with the node.

policy_name.description: Policy name associated with the node.

policy_group.description: Policy group associated with the node.

policy_revision.description: Policy revision associated with the node.

expanded_run_list.description: Expanded run list for the node.

projects.description: List of projects the node belongs to.

versioned_cookbooks.description: List of versioned cookbooks associated with the node.

skipped.description: Boolean denoting whether or not the run list item was skipped.

total.description: Total count of run reports that have landed in Automate for the node.

success.description: Total count of successful run reports that have landed in Automate for the node.

failure.description: Total count of failed run reports that have landed in Automate for the node.

values.title: Values of the field type with a count for each

count.title: The number of this distinct value

content.description: Exported reports in JSON or CSV.

page.description: Page number of the results to return.

size.description: Amount of results to include per page.

field.description: Field to sort the list results on.

order.description: Order the results should be returned in.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
